intro: Parabenzoin trilobum f. pilosum, commonly known as the hairy parabenzoin, is a rare variant of the parabenzoin species. It is characterized by its distinctive, hairy foliage that sets it apart from the typical form. The plant exhibits a compact growth habit with dense, overlapping leaves that are often covered in fine, soft hairs. It thrives in shaded, moist environments, typically found in temperate forest regions. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for taxonomists and botanists studying plant morphology and variation.
